people.name: The Ambitious Noble
people.description: Driven by a desire for power, status, or wealth, this person is calculating and willing to manipulate alliances, lead armies, or even betray others to rise through the ranks.

people.name: The Wayward Mercenary
people.description: A battle-hardened warrior who fights for gold, not honor. They have a cynical outlook on life, distrust authority, and follow their own code, though they might secretly yearn for purpose.

people.name: The Eccentric Wizard
people.description: This person is deeply knowledgeable about arcane lore, but their quirky behavior and obsession with magical experiments make them socially awkward or unpredictable.

people.name: The Religious Zealot
people.description: Completely devoted to their deity or cause, this character is fervent in their belief and is willing to perform extreme acts for what they believe is divine justice or righteousness.

people.name: The Reluctant Leader
people.description: Thrust into a position of authority they never wanted, this character is full of doubt but shows great empathy and a strong moral compass, often becoming a hero through their reluctance to embrace power.

people.name: The Charming Rogue
people.description: A quick-witted and smooth-talking scoundrel who thrives on deception and trickery. They have a knack for getting in and out of trouble, and may hide a heart of gold beneath their charisma.

people.name: The Jaded Veteran
people.description: A former soldier or adventurer who’s seen too many battles, this character is hardened and cynical. They might struggle with feelings of guilt or loss but are still fiercely loyal to their comrades.

people.name: The Aspiring Scholar
people.description: A young, curious individual who seeks knowledge above all else. They are enthusiastic and book-smart, though they may lack life experience and get in over their head when seeking ancient secrets.

people.name: The Haunted Survivor
people.description: This character has survived a traumatic event, whether it was a deadly battle, a magical curse, or the loss of loved ones. They are plagued by memories and often seek vengeance or redemption.

people.name: The Loyal Bodyguard
people.description: A stalwart protector who values loyalty above all else. They are steadfast, dependable, and put their charge's safety before their own life, even if it means making tough sacrifices.

people.name: The Free-spirited Bard
people.description: A wandering musician or storyteller, this person loves life, loves people, and has a natural ability to inspire those around them. They despise authority and prefer a carefree existence.

people.name: The Ruthless Pirate
people.description: An opportunistic individual, often from a coastal or port city, who uses violence and intimidation to get what they want. They may be cutthroat in business dealings but often have a twisted sense of honor.

people.name: The Visionary Leader
people.description: A charismatic person who sees the potential for a better world, often rallying people to their cause through speeches and ideals. However, their ambition sometimes blinds them to the consequences of their actions.

people.name: The Reclusive Alchemist
people.description: A genius at their craft, this character has withdrawn from society, content to pursue their own research or experiments. They can be paranoid or secretive, but their knowledge is invaluable.

people.name: The Pacifist Healer
people.description: A character who detests violence and seeks to help others through non-combat means. They may be a wandering cleric or druid who believes in healing the world rather than causing harm.

places.name: Citadel
places.description: A stronghold or fortified city, often representing a center of power or defense. It could be home to rulers, military forces, or religious leaders.

places.name: Dungeon
places.description: Underground lairs, catacombs, or ancient tombs filled with traps, monsters, and treasures. Dungeons are quintessential adventure locations.

places.name: Forest
places.description: Dense woodlands filled with flora, fauna, and often magical creatures. Forests might be places of refuge, mystery, or danger.

places.name: Ruins
places.description: Crumbling remnants of ancient civilizations, where adventurers uncover lost knowledge, treasure, or curses. Ruins often hold echoes of the past.

places.name: Port
places.description: A coastal or river city that thrives on trade and maritime culture. Ports can be bustling with commerce or rife with pirate and smuggler activity.

places.name: Mountain
places.description: Tall peaks and ranges that house dangerous creatures, secluded monks, or ancient dragons. Mountains are often symbols of isolation or challenge.

places.name: Swamp
places.description: Wetlands filled with muck, murk, and decay. Swamps are often homes to dangerous creatures, hidden covens, or forgotten treasures.

places.name: Desert
places.description: A vast, arid expanse where survival is difficult. Deserts may hide ancient ruins, nomadic tribes, or powerful elemental beings.

places.name: Cavern
places.description: Deep underground caves or networks, often leading to natural wonders or dark dangers. Caverns can also connect to the Underdark in many D&D settings.

places.name: Fortress
places.description: A militaristic stronghold, often on the frontiers of civilization. Fortresses serve as the first line of defense or the last bastion of survival.

places.name: Temple
places.description: Religious sanctuaries or sacred sites, often dedicated to a god or pantheon. Temples may be centers of healing, divine intervention, or hidden prophecies.

places.name: Market
places.description: A lively marketplace, where adventurers can trade goods, gather information, or meet with unsavory characters. Markets are often hubs of activity and intrigue.

places.name: Village
places.description: A small, rural community, where life is simple but often threatened by outside forces like bandits, monsters, or dark magic.

places.name: Keep
places.description: A small, defensible castle, often ruled by a minor noble or a retired adventurer. Keeps serve as bases of operations or defensive outposts.

places.name: Road
places.description: A well-traveled path or highway, where adventurers encounter travelers, merchants, or ambushes. Roads connect the world and provide access to both civilized and wild places.

energies.name: Mysticism
energies.description: Encompassing magic, rituals, and the unknown. This could refer to sorcery, divine powers, or ancient arcane knowledge hidden in the world.

energies.name: Civilization
energies.description: The structures, politics, and societies that govern cities, empires, and realms. This includes both the culture of the people and the architectural marvels.

energies.name: Wildness
energies.description: The untamed, raw, and primal aspects of nature, including beasts, wilderness, and natural forces that operate outside of civilization.

energies.name: Eternity
energies.description: The sense of timelessness found in legendary artifacts, ancient beings, or realms like the Astral Plane. This relates to immortality, history, and the eternal nature of certain entities.

energies.name: Chaos
energies.description: The unpredictable and often destructive forces that disrupt order, including wild magic, demonic influences, or chaotic gods like those found in the D&D pantheon.

energies.name: Discovery
energies.description: The thrill and process of exploration, including delving into forgotten ruins, uncovering ancient secrets, or navigating uncharted territories.

energies.name: Illusion
energies.description: Deception, trickery, and the manipulation of perception. This can be literal magical illusions or metaphorical in the sense of lies, disguises, and betrayal.

energies.name: Honor
energies.description: The personal and societal codes of conduct, often associated with knights, warriors, or noble houses. It’s linked to duty, loyalty, and the burden of maintaining one's word.

energies.name: Decay
energies.description: The slow erosion of life, civilizations, and the physical world. It may reflect rot, disease, or the metaphorical decay of institutions and ideals.

energies.name: Enchantment
energies.description: The presence of wonder and allure, often associated with magical items, charming characters, or landscapes imbued with supernatural beauty.

energies.name: Corruption
energies.description: The moral and physical degradation caused by power, dark magic, or the influence of malevolent forces. This can apply to individuals, political systems, or magical artifacts.

energies.name: Salvation
energies.description: The act of being saved or redeemed, either spiritually, politically, or physically. Heroes often embark on quests that revolve around salvation, whether saving a kingdom or their own souls.

energies.name: Isolation
energies.description: The feeling of being apart, whether it’s an isolated character, a forgotten realm, or a secluded fortress. Isolation may also refer to outcast beings or hidden societies.

energies.name: Fortitude
energies.description: Resilience and strength, both mental and physical, that characters or civilizations show in the face of adversity. It includes endurance through trials and battles.

energies.name: Whimsy
energies.description: The light-hearted, unpredictable, and often playful elements of the world. This could refer to fey creatures, magical pranks, or surreal, dream-like environments.
